page.title: 17St.Mary's Church Basingstoke
page.content: { St. Mary's Church}in{Eastrop}is quite small, it is made of{mostly stones}and {bricks.}It is{divided}into{three {sections,}the first one is the oldest, then the second one and the third. On the{end}of the Church is a sort of {office}where there are lots of {leaflets}and books. The Church{dates back from{1236. Underneath}the Church are{vaults}with seven or eight{coffins piled on top of each other.{Inside}the Church is a{window}in{memory}of a{boy{ who got{killed}by a{horse and cart.}It happened in{1878,}his{name}was{Arthur {Perry Jennings}and he was only{five {years old.}The{organ in}the Church came from the{Wote Street}Church that got{demolished.}The{vicar}is{Alex {Ross,}he's been there for{five years. There are{four services}on a{Sunday, at 8a.m. 9.30a.m. 11a.m. and 6.30p.m. By Denise Webber
